I'm [Ed Rubin](bio.html), an assistant professor in the [Department of Economics](https://economics.uoregon.edu) at the [University of Oregon](https://www.uoregon.edu).

<h3>`research`</h3>

I'm an environmental economist who researches how human behavior (individual and policy) affects social equity and the health of the natural world.

As an empiricist, I tackle these issues with a toolbox that draws from economics, econometrics, statistics, and data science.

Examples from a few recent projects…
<br>↳ [*strategically missing data in air-quality monitors*](Papers/draft-strategic-monitoring.pdf)
<br>↳ [*unequal wildfire smoke avoidance*](Papers/draft-smoke.pdf)
<br>↳ [*a field experiment in customer-based gender bias*](Papers/draft-gender-bias.pdf)
<br>↳ [*pitfalls of injecting machine learning into a 2SLS framework*](Papers/draft-mliv.pdf)
<br>↳ [*strategic location of coal-fueled power plants*](Papers/draft-plant-locations.pdf)
